quotes.quote: Anyone who thinks he's too small to make a difference has never been bit by a mosquito.
Take a lesson from the mosquito. She never waits for an opening - she makes one.
Mosquitoes are like family: They are annoying, but they carry your blood.
If you stay long enough in paradise, you're bound to get bitten by mosquitos.
A mosquito is a more rational creature than a human being because it follows its instincts. Whereas a human being gets bogged down in an endless tangle of contradictory doubts and desires.
You do not respond to a mosquito bite with a hammer.
People who say that small things don't bother them have never slept in a room with a mosquito.
You don't hate the mosquito; you just want it out of your face.
If you don't think a small act can make a difference, try going to sleep with a mosquito in the room.
Mosquitoes bite you as if they are in some kind of love with you.
Anyone who thinks that they are too small to make a difference has never tried to fall asleep with a mosquito in the room.
If only mosquitoes sucked fat instead of blood.
Mosquitoes remind us that we are not as high up on the food chain as we think.
